fields.title: Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't!
fields.content: According to botanical definitions, bananas are classified as berries, while strawberries are not because their seeds are on the outside.

fields.title: A day on Venus is longer than a year!
fields.content: Venus takes about 243 Earth days to complete one rotation on its axis, but only 225 days to orbit the Sun.

fields.title: Octopuses have three hearts!
fields.content: Two hearts pump blood to the gills, while the third pumps it to the rest of the body. They even change color when they're happy or stressed!

fields.title: Sharks existed before trees!
fields.content: Sharks have been around for about 400 million years, while trees appeared around 350 million years ago.

fields.title: Bees can recognize human faces!
fields.content: Despite their small brains, bees can identify and remember individual human faces using a technique similar to the way humans do.

fields.title: The Eiffel Tower can grow taller in the summer!
fields.content: Due to thermal expansion, the metal expands when it's hot, making the Eiffel Tower about 15 cm (6 inches) taller during the summer.

fields.title: Wombat poop is cube-shaped!
fields.content: Wombats are the only animals known to produce cube-shaped poop, which helps prevent it from rolling away and helps them mark territory.

fields.title: A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance!
fields.content: Fittingly, the bright and colorful flamingos have a fancy name for their gatherings.

fields.title: Honey never spoils!
fields.content: Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.

fields.title: Thereâ€™s a species of jellyfish that can live forever!
fields.content: The Turritopsis dohrnii jellyfish can revert its cells to their earliest form and start its life cycle over again, potentially making it biologically immortal.
